comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Irene Foote Castle (1893-1969), dancer: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vernon_and_Irene_Castle Showing off her no-corset style, her bobbed hair, and her pet monkey (is he smoking, or is that a scratch on the plate?).

comment.author: 17264356@N00
comment._content: Even at the largest size it looks like the monkey is smoking, or otherwise has something in it's mouth.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: According to The Toronto World - Mar 26, 1916 news.google.com/newspapers?nid=22&dat=19160326&id... Irene Castle had a pet French Guinea monkey called Rastus, "much photographed and written of." Apparently when she sat down to write to her husband, the monkey insisted on having paper and pencil!

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks to pennylrichardsca and swanq for your research into this fascinating woman.  And that is most likely "Rastus" whom she's holding.  But I can't verify whether or not she let him smoke.  We'll add some of this information to the record the next time we update.

comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: The tiff version seems to exonerate Ms. Castle:
